intro: Cirsium monspessulanum var. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, featuring upright, spiny stems and lobed, gray-green leaves with rough textures. The plant produces purple to pinkish flowers in dense, spherical clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas. This variety is characterized by its intermediate features between the typical C. monspessulanum and other related thistle species.
